authors.author: Adoniram J. Gordon William R. Featherston

verse.name: v1a
verse.lines:
My Jesus I love Thee;
I know Thou art mine.
For Thee all the follies
Of sin I resign.

verse.name: v1b
verse.lines:
My gracious Redeemer,
My Savior art Thou.
If ever I loved Thee,
My Jesus, 'tis now.

verse.name: v2a
verse.lines:
I love Thee,
Because Thou hast first loved me,
And purchased my pardon
On Calvary's tree.
I love Thee

verse.name: v2b
verse.lines:
For wearing the thorns
On Thy brow,
If ever I loved Thee,
My Jesus, 'tis now.

verse.name: v3a
verse.lines:
I'll love Thee in life,
I will love Thee in death,
And praise Thee

verse.name: v3b
verse.lines:
As long as Thou lendest me breath;
And say when the death dew
Lies cold on my brow,
"If ever I loved Thee,
My Jesus 'tis now."

verse.name: v4a
verse.lines:
In mansions of glory
And endless delight,
I'll ever adore Thee
In heaven so bright.

verse.name: v4b
verse.lines:
I'll sing with the glittering crown
On my brow,
"If ever I loved Thee,
My Jesus, 'tis now."
